definition: (of a nation, government etc) demoralized/disunited
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
to dissipate/to dissolve
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
variant of 散[san4]

sentences.english: Europe's unraveling is also a problem for Americans.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的人心涣散同样也是美国人的难题。

sentences.english: Europe’s unraveling is also a problem for Americans.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的人心涣散同样也是美国人的难题。

sentences.english: Accounting information forge cases rise one after another.
sentences.chinese: 会计信息造假案此起彼伏，股市人心涣散。

definition: lit. a thunder of dragons without a head/fig. a group lacking a leader
lit. like a sheet of loose sand/fig. unable to cooperate (idiom)
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
more hands than needed (idiom); too many cooks spoil the broth
to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
internal contradiction
internal friction/internal dissipation of energy (in mechanics)/fig. waste or discord within an organization
When the tree topples the monkeys scatter. (idiom); fig. an opportunist abandons an unfavorable cause/Rats leave a sinking ship.
internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
lit. cries of complaint fill the roads (idiom); complaints rise all around/discontent is openly voiced
utterly defeated/routed/crushed/to collapse (of army)
scattered sand/fig. lacking in cohesion or organization
not to enjoy popular support/to be unpopular
internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
to do things each in one's own way
internal power struggle
